alert.note: Alert for Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 11:09PM EDT until July 11 at 7:04PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Sugar River At West Claremont affecting Sullivan County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sugar River at West Claremont. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Twistback Road and Beauregard Street are flooded in West Claremont. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM EDT Monday the stage was 7.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 PM EDT Monday was 7.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 9.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to 5.5 feet tomorrow evening. It will rise to 6.2 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
